com.github.wolf480pl.log4j2_to_jul.context

Class JULLogger

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.logging.log4j.spi.AbstractLogger
      • com.github.wolf480pl.log4j2_to_jul.context.JULLogger
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.apache.logging.log4j.Logger

    public class JULLogger
extends org.apache.logging.log4j.spi.AbstractLogger
    An implementation of Logger that redirects all the log messages to specified Logger.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String DEFAULT_FORMAT
      The default format for adding Markers to the message.
      static String PASSTHRU_FORMAT
      A passthru format - leaves the message intact.

    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULT_FORMAT

        public static final String DEFAULT_FORMAT
        The default format for adding Markers to the message. It prepends the marker name followed by " - " at the beginning of the message.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PASSTHRU_FORMAT

        public static final String PASSTHRU_FORMAT
        A passthru format - leaves the message intact.

    • Method Detail

      • setFormat

        public void setFormat(String format)
        Sets the format to apply on the messages before passing them to Logger.

        The format string is in the same syntax as in String.format(String, Object...).

        If the format string is null (the default), for messages logged with this logger that have a non-empty Marker, the DEFAULT_FORMAT will be used to add the marker to the message string. Messages that have empty (null or getName() == "") Marker will be passed to Logger intact.

        If the format string is not null, messages logged with this logger will be formatted with it. The format will be used like `message = String.format(format, message, marker)` so it can be used to add marker to the message.

        Parameters:
        format - the format string

      • getFormat

        public String getFormat()
        Returns the format to apply on the messages before passing them to Logger.
        Returns:
        the format string
        See Also:
        setFormat(String)
